IonicSecurity::SDK::KeyAttributesMapMergerDefault Class Reference

void mergeKeyAttributeMaps (bool bAttributesAreMutable, AttributesDictionary ^ dictOriginalServerAttributesIn, AttributesDictionary ^ dictCurrentServerAttributesIn, AttributesDictionary ^ dictClientAttributesIn, AttributesDictionary ^% dictMergedAttributesOut)
 Perform key attribute merge operation. More...
 

Detailed Description

Interface used during protection key update operations to merge key attributes when needed.

This interface defines a pure virtual method for merging key attributes in the event that a merge is needed during a protection key update operation (Agent::UpdateKeys()).

The SDK provides a default implementation of this interface in ISKeyAttributesMapMergerDefault.

See also
Agent::UpdateKeys()
Agent::UpdateKey()
AGENT_STALE_KEY_ATTRIBUTES
KeyAttributesMapMergerDefault

Member Function Documentation

◆ mergeKeyAttributeMaps()

void IonicSecurity::SDK::KeyAttributesMapMergerDefault::mergeKeyAttributeMaps ( bool  bAttributesAreMutable,
AttributesDictionary ^  dictOriginalServerAttributesIn,
AttributesDictionary ^  dictCurrentServerAttributesIn,
AttributesDictionary ^  dictClientAttributesIn,
AttributesDictionary ^%  dictMergedAttributesOut 
)

Perform key attribute merge operation.

Parameters
[in]bAttributesAreMutableSpecifies if the attributes being merged are mutable or not.
[in]dictOriginalServerAttributesInThe attributes originally received from the server during a past key create, fetch, or update operation.
[in]dictCurrentServerAttributesInThe attributes as they are currently known to the server.
[in]dictClientAttributesInThe attributes known to the client.
[out]dictMergedAttributesOutThe output attributes resulting from the merge operation.

This function should be used to perform key attribute merging when conflict resolution is needed, as indicated by the ErrorCode::AGENT_STALE_KEY_ATTRIBUTES returned by any key update request.



Example scenario:

  • Client A retrieves key X
  • Client B retrieves key X
  • Client A updates key X
  • Client B updates key X (conflict detected here, as indicated by ErrorCode::AGENT_STALE_KEY_ATTRIBUTES error code)
  • Client B retrieves key X again to get the latest version
  • Client B performs attribute merge operation via this function (mergeKeyAttributeMaps())
  • Client B attempts to update key X again after the attribute merging
